txt.en: Instance: Confronting Ardhun
'I am in no mood for games, Ardhun.'
'What do you want? Why have you come here in force?'
'There are more than enough warriors to defend home.'
'Lhan Garan needs me. Are they not our people too?'
'Oh Ardy. I'm so sorry.'
'I swore an oath to the people of Lhan Garan.'
'You know how I am with oaths.'
'Are you hurt?'
'Ardhun...'
'Break before me!'
'You -- stay where you are.'
'Eluna! You look worse for wear.'
'What's wrong, my dear? Did you lose your footing and take a bad tumble?'
'We came to bring you home to Brundir, of course. Our enemy is on the move.'
'You are one of our greatest warriors and leaders.'
'Ardhun, I- Wait. Someone is coming!'
'Your people need you, Eluna.'
'Traitors! Deserters! These are the people you throw in with?'
'They do not deserve you.'
'No. There is no need to harm her.'
'She will come back willingly. She will renounce Lhan Garan and come home to us.'
'I was wondering why you left camp on your own, but I see you've managed to draw our quarry into the open.'
'How clever of you.'
What? -- You!'
'It pains me to do this, Eluna, but your departure has shaken our people's faith in the cause.'
'Many speak of reconsidering our alliances, and of leaving to join you in Lhan Garan.'
'When we bring your head back, they will understand the price of dissention and desertion.'
'How noble. Now die.'
'Won't you?'
'We will take them together!'
'No!'
'Are you all right?'
'It would seem I have chosen my side.'
